column1: My statement on the 5.9 GHz band proposal that @FCC will consider at tomorrow’s Open Meeting: https://t.co/AVN9zb5vyu

My bill the READI Act (H.R. 6096) just passed the House. It will improve the WEA system and emergency alerting more broadly so that my constituents and Americans across the country can count on receiving these alerts when faced with emergencies including wildfires. https://t.co/cKvdUe7ayc

Now more than ever health insurance coverage is critical. Covered California’s open enrollment has begun and Californians have until January 31st 2021 to sign up for health insurance. Visit https://t.co/fEqyQTjsrK for more information. https://t.co/mWHqwzRd1l

There is no greater service than putting your life on the line to protect our nation. Today we honor and celebrate the sacrifice of our brave men and women in uniform. Happy Veterans Day. https://t.co/pzKDAcJlMb
I join Joe Biden in asking for everyone to come together to work for the betterment of our country.
Congratulations to President-elect Joe Biden and Vice President-elect Kamala Harris. I look forward to working with the Biden-Harris Administration to combat the challenges our nation is facing.

When nearly all aspects of our lives depend on connectivity Americans deserve to know detailed information about problems consumers are facing with their internet and phone service and if the problems are being resolved. I'm asking @AjitPaiFCC to make consumer complaints public. https://t.co/NGOb3sCZN2

Ensuring everyone has the tools they need to safely work and study from home during a pandemic is essential. We need to restore #NetNeutrality and expand internet access but today the #Trump @FCC voted once again to prioritize corporate profits over public safety. https://t.co/dvmQW67shU

Due to extreme weather in our region PG&E will be shutting off power in some areas. Outages are expected to begin today and will continue through Tuesday. For more information on if and how this may impact your community please visit: https://t.co/hUaMvsKMh2
Thank you to everyone who organized and participated in this weekend's Walk to End Alzheimer's in Stockton. https://t.co/2LdIXF4McB

I'm hosting a virtual information session for high school students interested in attending a military service academy on Wednesday October 7 2020 from 6:00 PM – 8:00 PM PT. Representatives from my office and various service academies will be available for questions. https://t.co/kPOKbCldKc

575 days. That’s how long it’s been since the House passed #HR8 the Bipartisan Background Checks Act and how long McConnell has ignored the bill. Today as gun deaths continue to rise as our nation is sheltered in place we #WearOrangeMasks to urge the Senate to take action. https://t.co/H4iUps5JRi
Participating in our democracy is critically important. If you’re not registered to vote #NationalVoterRegistrationDay is a great day to do it! Visit https://t.co/h62Zo6Q1KC now to get registered.

Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! Registering to vote and updating your voter registration information are the first steps to being #VoteReady in the upcoming election. Register to vote at https://t.co/VlDr97qwxa
I’m sending a letter to @energy @doescience asking how they plan to avert this now and prevent it in the future. We can’t cede this ground to other countries.

Reaching the next level of computing power - exascale - is critical for advanced scientific research and success on the world stage. The US was set to break that barrier next year but recent reporting says we will now miss the strategic 2021 deadline.

Proud that my legislation the AI in Government Act (H.R. 2575) passed the House floor today! This bill will help increase AI adoption across the federal government in a smart and responsible way and in doing so equip agencies with tools to better serve the American people.
Join Online: https://t.co/oqlkDDhDbG  Passcode: 967360  OR  Join by Phone: (669) 900-6833   Webinar ID: 998 8381 8132 Passcode: 967360

I'm hosting a Virtual Town Hall on Distance Learning and the Digital Divide on Tuesday August 25th from 4:30 – 6:00 PM to discuss what's being at the federal and local level to address challenges we're facing as the COVID-19 pandemic has forced a shift to distance learning. https://t.co/OldzAcCffj

Thank you Chief Brian Helmick and the firefighters at East Contra Costa Fire Protection District for heroically battling the Deer Zone fires. We are grateful for all you do to keep our community safe. https://t.co/PZYMlbsXpU

.@FCC must take all possible steps to help ensure Californians stay connected during wildfires and rolling blackouts. @RepAnnaEshoo @DorisMatsui and I are requesting a briefing from @AjitPaiFCC on steps the agency is taking in response to these events. https://t.co/Do8Qij2isS

Airlines' patchwork of rules & protocol has resulted in confusion that could undermine public health. I led a letter to U.S.-based airlines urging them to work together on comprehensive industry-wide policies to address current health & safety concerns. https://t.co/RI4rPFY0Ps

This Congressional Startup Day I participated in a virtual tour of the new Nautilus data center in @Stockton_Cali. This green infrastructure will play a critical role in drawing more innovation and investment to our community and region. https://t.co/fU1E4QFEto
It takes Black women an average of 8 extra months to earn what White males take home in just one year. It’s time for #BlackWomensEqualPay now.

The reality is that he is not willing to put in the hard work required to get an effective package for people in desperate need. This pandemic has clearly shown that this President and the Republican Party are incompetent and unfit to run our country.
They’re unconstitutional and serve no real purpose other than to try to dupe the American people into thinking the president is making an effort on their behalf.
The President’s recently issued executive orders are a political stunt that offer no relief for hurting families. They are designed to cripple Social Security and Medicare.
55 years ago President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the #VotingRightsAct to remind us of our nation’s core values. Our fight continues today. https://t.co/5Q7vMoP49X

Seniors & people with disabilities face a greater risk of #COVID19 complications. We must protect the most vulnerable among us by: ✅ addressing the crisis in our nursing homes ✅ strengthening #Medicaid ✅ funding #HCBS #NoOneLeftBehind https://t.co/igY8MMaiA2

Cutting short the data collection process for the 2020 Census is a blatant attempt to undermine our democracy. The Constitution requires all persons be counted. This is vital to ensuring communities throughout the country get the resources they need. https://t.co/0RK0H2dCvP

San Joaquin County in my district is one of the latest to be declared a COVID-19 hotspot. Over two months ago the House passed the #HEROESAct but it's still sitting on @senatemajldr’s desk. The Republican-controlled Senate must join the House in meeting this challenge head on. https://t.co/pQFdnCQ150

You called for change and @HouseDemocrats responded by passing the #JusticeInPolicing Act. But Senate Republicans have ignored this bill and the continued outcry from Americans. They work #ForThePeople. It's time they act like it and pass this legislation. https://t.co/t5PGzh1pZK
Masks help protect you and those around you so if you have to go out into public spaces please remember to wear a mask. #WearAMaskSaveLives https://t.co/eI1PBwbF4L

Experts say the United States needs 2.1 million daily #COVID19 tests – that’s three times what we have now. Additionally we’ve faced PPE shortages for months but the president refuses to take action. He must use the full power of the Defense Production Act immediately.
Happy birthday @WhipClyburn! https://t.co/ATnawNRYSu

It’s been more than 3 weeks since the House passed the #JusticeInPolicing Act - which would ban chokeholds like the one used in the murder of #GeorgeFloyd - but still no action has been taken by the Senate. Silence is complicity @senatemajldr.

He pushed for change - from fighting tirelessly against discrimination and unjust wars to championing much-needed gun reforms and universal access to health care. He will be remembered with great respect and affection and will be greatly missed.

Today we mourn as our nation has lost a champion in the quest for a more perfect union. When I think of John Lewis I think of moral authority. As the “conscience of Congress” John put his life and freedom on the line in pursuit of an equal and just America.

The READI Act will ensure that we can count on receiving these alerts during wildfires and other emergencies. I’m proud that my bill is one of 30 bipartisan bills that we passed out of @EnergyCommerce during today’s markup.

As we continue to battle #COVID19 this year’s wildfire season presents unprecedented challenges for first responders and the public especially when it comes to evacuations. This makes it even more crucial that we have emergency alerting systems that are robust and reliable.

Because of the #climatecrisis the wildfire season in California and across the West is starting earlier and ending later each year. Our state is already in the midst of another dry hot summer and bracing for a likely dire wildfire season.

Today @EnergyCommerce voted to approve my bill H.R. 6096 the READI Act. This legislation will improve the reliability of emergency alerts — lifesaving tools to disseminate information to the public during times of emergency.

Every day #farmworkers are risking their lives to feed our nation during the #COVID19 pandemic yet many struggle with food insecurity. We must eliminate barriers to SNAP and other food security programs. #HealthEquity #HEAA2020  https://t.co/XgCpORYZVB

The president has an obligation to investigate the accusation that Russia placed a bounty on American soldiers but once again all we’re hearing from this White House is denial and deflection. https://t.co/KED1RrKkBJ

We must ensure science has a seat at the table as we work toward #SolvingTheClimateCrisis. Today's report from @ClimateCrisis highlights a number of potential legislative actions to combat the effects of #climatechange including three bills I introduced. https://t.co/O6cK7tbWCY

From students trying to do homework to seniors in need of telehealth - those on the wrong side of the digital divide face a devastating impact. My bill the Digital Equity Act is included in #MovingForward & would close gaps in broadband adoption & promote digital skills.

As a mathematician I’m baffled that my Republican colleagues can’t seem to follow the numbers. It’s time for my friends across the aisle to do the math and more importantly to listen to their constituents who deserve #LowerCostsForCare. https://t.co/B4I3EkvewU

Today the U.S. House of Representatives showed the world that we believe Black lives matter. Racism persists in America today poisoning our institutions. But the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act would make a real difference by instituting much needed systemic change. https://t.co/LmU7x0vPQx

What does @Facebook have to hide? They've been dodging my questions about their content moderation practices for over a year. I discussed this issue and others at today's @EnergyCommerce hearing about online disinformation. https://t.co/Y2YOrpXT8w

Within his own administration President Trump's decision to withdraw from the @WHO has sparked concern. Yesterday Dr. Fauci & @CDCdi confirmed to me that their scientific expertise was not requested before the president's disastrous announcement. https://t.co/TGa7EinogY

On #Juneteenth we commemorate the end of slavery in our nation. But 155 years later African Americans still suffer its repercussions as vast inequality continues to plague our country. The fight for true equality is not over. Change is long overdue.

This week’s SCOTUS decision outlawed workplace discrimination for the LGBTQ+ community. But in too many other areas of life Americans lack clear protections from discrimination. The #EqualityAct will fix this injustice. It’s time for the Senate to pass this legislation. https://t.co/uGtbw4ABxZ
Today's SCOTUS decision is not only a win for our Dreamers but for all Americans. Our nation is only made stronger by our diverse population.  https://t.co/KvspOzsI0S
Fill out your Census. Be counted. Pass it on. #2020Census  https://t.co/SMF540ondv https://t.co/J5mn45Pkkw

The U.S. Postal Service is largest employer of our nation's veterans with a diverse workforce that handles nearly half the world's mail. It is imperative that Congress address the financial hardships that this institution is facing due to the Covid-19 pandemic. https://t.co/wFhXRM2oW5
This National Gun Violence Awarness Day I #wearorange for the victims of gun violence. They have not been forgotten and I will continue to work to make our communities safer. https://t.co/v5XtN88TZ8

The remnants of slavery and the Jim Crow era persist in our living institutions - from our criminal justice system to our economy and even health care. We must demand institutional change. Remember your voice counts and the world is listening. https://t.co/XShaAqGLu7
We cannot allow this abuse of power to go unchecked. That’s why I joined my colleagues in calling for a special prosecutor to investigate Attorney General Barr. https://t.co/9CcAX9fzwE
General Mattis has said it best. https://t.co/iT1MLOEwol

The president would have America become a police state. He has called for “overwhelming force” to “dominate” American citizens who are lawfully exercising their first amendment right. We have not and will not be ruled by a dictator. https://t.co/Ta04RLFMsh

My office has compiled a resource guide to provide my constituents with a one-stop-shop for information on crucial programs services and resources to weather these unprecedented times. https://t.co/AHeIzJ8Byt

We cannot allow those charged with protecting our communities to operate in a way that disregards human life and dignity. It must be clear that those who act this way will be held accountable. America must be better than this.  https://t.co/nXUptzjNno
This Executive Order is a blatant abuse of power in a desperate attempt to bend the president’s critics to his will. https://t.co/DvIB9mWqaj

In Antioch we commemorated this #MemorialDay with a self-guided tour of local veteran and first responder memorials ending with a stop at VFW Post 6435 to help hand out BBQ-to-go. I hope you’ll take a moment today to honor the sacrifice made by our men and women in uniform. https://t.co/m00oQ99rDY

We don’t have time to play politics. Right now our focus must be on helping Americans survive this crisis. That’s why I was proud to vote for the passage of the #HeroesAct today. https://t.co/ChV3QpqpqD

70 years ago Congress established @NSF to promote the progress of science; advance the national health prosperity and welfare; and to secure our national defense. Seven decades of funding basic research has established the U.S. as a science and technology leader.
Appreciating our mothers transcends any and all daily trials. Happy Mother’s Day to every mom - we appreciate you! https://t.co/D6Z80ZjeIy
It’s too bad that being ‘conservative’ these days means being anti-science.  https://t.co/Cg6SDws57C

Right now our teachers are overcoming the challenges of distance learning to ensure our children can get the education they deserve. This #TeacherAppreciationWeek I hope you’ll join me in thanking the teachers in your community. https://t.co/27lofK0L7q

May is #MentalHealthAwarenessMonth and as many struggle with additional anxiety due to the COVID-19 pandemic the CDC has compiled a list of resources and tips to help Americans cope with the stress. https://t.co/Q94ZAhbWNW

This morning I volunteered to help distribute food at the Oakley Senior Center. No one should have to hungry during these difficult times and I’m proud our community is coming together to help those in need. https://t.co/39uf4ZCPWo
Our essential workers are fundamental to our nation’s response efforts and I hope you’ll join me in thanking them for their dedication to our community and our country. https://t.co/AMmZdRhQW4

California’s first responders are on the frontlines of this pandemic. @FCC’s refusal to extend the #NetNeutrality comment deadline despite current circumstances is a slap in the face to the people putting their lives on the line to serve our communities. https://t.co/7fvkkLu8Kz

Rushing the rulemaking process & not giving Americans ample time to weigh in on decisions that affect their health removes a critical layer of transparency. I along with @BobbyScott & @RepMikeQuigley led a letter urging @EPAAWheeler to extend deadlines. https://t.co/sRaeUW2yIe

Personal attacks on an officer negatively impact troop morale and are unbefitting of a leader in our nation’s armed services. The acting Secretary of the Navy Thomas Modly should resign. https://t.co/U8UboSjiAX

America's homeless population is particularly vulnerable during this pandemic. I led a letter with 87 of my colleagues pressing the Trump Administration for details about how agencies are working to ensure proper care for America’s homeless at this time. https://t.co/1vEGm22VJK

In 2019 women in America made on average just 81% of what their male counterparts earned. Now more than ever we are seeing why ALL workers must be treated equally with #EqualPay for equal work. https://t.co/lgosN7lHLT

I came to Washington to ensure passage of the CARES Act so Americans will have what they need during this crisis. I will continue to listen to experts and scientists to curb the spread of COVID-19 and protect the long-term health of our economy.
I’m about to vote on the CARES Act to ensure hospitals have the resources they need during this emergency and to protect those who face financial upheaval.

As we navigate the #COVID19 crisis Americans need access to paid sick leave and paid family and medical leave. That’s why I’m proud to have voted for the #FamiliesFirst #Coronavirus Response Act. https://t.co/5Jwwbh7BvS

It’s critical that Americans are able to stay connected during these unprecedented times and that communications providers consider all of the ways that they can aid the broader community in this effort.

And for those who can’t telework or have to take time off because they don't have childcare for their school-aged children the financial burden can become so great they may not be able to pay for their broadband service.

Millions of Americans without broadband will also be impacted. Even if someone in a household has a smartphone and a wireless subscription they may quickly exceed a data cap when attempting to telework use telehealth services and monitor critical #COVID19 information.

#COVID19 has already forced some schools to close and it’s anticipated that more will have to shut down as the virus continues to spread. While many are making plans for virtual learning the 12 million students who don't have broadband at home will be left behind.

I’m pleased to see that a number of these companies are making announcements about their plans to address some of these challenges. My @EnergyCommerce colleagues and I are looking forward to receiving more information about their plans and hearing from other companies. https://t.co/z1VaQJMZmi

As we work to limit the spread of #COVID19 connectivity is more important than ever. That’s why I sent a letter to 9 major communications providers asking them to outline their plans to address Americans’ connectivity challenges during this time. https://t.co/TNBB24fshW

To limit the exposure and spread of #COVID19 in high traffic visitor centers in Washington D.C. all tours – including the U.S. Capitol White House Library of Congress and Supreme Court – have been suspended until further notice.
Women make up almost half of the American workforce but hold less than a quarter of jobs in #STEM fields. It’s simple math. When women succeed we all succeed. https://t.co/riFMzOuajz

This is NOT a Chinese virus – it’s a disease that affects the global community. This kind of language only serves to stoke fear and promote a racist and blatantly false narrative. https://t.co/kLpe6TQAri

It’s time to end political interference with women’s private medical decisions. It’s time for the Women’s Health Protection Act #WHPA. https://t.co/4Bzk5A6b0G

#CitizensUnited opened a floodgate of corporate spending in politics and caused a wave of dark money to wash over our elections drowning out the voices of the American people.
This is a sad day for our nation. With this vote Senate Republicans have signed off on foreign interference in our elections.

Protecting people with pre-existing conditions is something we can all agree on. At tonight’s #SOTU I want to hear how we can work together to improve the #StateOfHealthCare #ForThePeople. https://t.co/dhdAURVqYF
Don’t forget today is the last day for Californians to sign-up for health insurance through @CoveredCA. https://t.co/RBo5GLNmRO

The Trump Administration is trying to throw people off the #SocialSecurity rolls with their proposed rule for disability insurance. Americans EARN these benefits! That’s why I joined 100+ of my colleagues calling on them to halt this disastrous proposal! #NoSocialSecurityCuts

Fred Korematsu challenged an Executive Order that forcefully interned hundreds of thousands of Japanese Americans during WWII. On #KorematsuDay we commemorate his contributions to ensuring Americans' civil liberties and his tireless work against injustice in our nation.

Any senator who validates these outrageous claims is paving the way for a government that operates outside the bounds of its own laws giving unrestrained power to lawmakers with no mechanism to hold them accountable. Is that what we want as a nation?

Acquitting this president will open a floodgate of foreign interference in our elections justified by using this same argument. This assertion could also be used to defend other wrongful acts by lawmakers & candidates rendering them impervious to consequences for their misdeeds.

The president's lawyers have argued that his office affords him unprecedented power and by extension anyone running for office cannot be held accountable for breaking the law if it’s in an effort to get elected.

During the recent wildfires 88 cell towers went down in @CCCounty cutting people off from emergency services & loved ones. I asked @AjitPaiFCC to hold a field hearing in Northern California on this issue & today I'm following up on his commitment to me. https://t.co/cWqDKLsque

The balance of power in our nation is derived from our Constitution. Anyone who votes to leave this president in office will be an accomplice to the collapse of our country’s very foundation. https://t.co/M54wdXRJRR

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Stockton and Antioch open house events! Your thoughts and concerns are important to me and these events are a great opportunity for me to hear directly from you about the critical issues facing our community and our nation. https://t.co/W0rc8K9Csg
If you’re in the Antioch area I hope you can make it to my Antioch office for my open house tonight! https://t.co/7Nl15R68cC

This sham trial proves that the GOP is officially the party of Trump. Both House and Senate Republicans have shown that they are governed by the fear of crossing their leader rather than the oath they swore to uphold. This is a sad statement about the future of our democracy.

Looking forward to seeing everyone at my open house in Stockton tonight! Stop by my office between 6:00 PM - 7:30 PM for an update on what's happening in Washington and a discussion about the important issues impacting our nation. https://t.co/Fd01iNRFJl

This year marks the 25th anniversary of the day of service that honors Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. As we celebrate his life and the contributions he made to our nation I hope you’ll join me in recommitting to finding ways to best serve our own community.  https://t.co/jrPysrVWcD
